author: fluffy__cat
content: Greetings everyone. Not sure if this is the best place to ask: I'm interested in contributing to the development and accelerated adoption of social recovery wallets similar to what Vitalik outlined here ( https://vitalik.ca/general/2021/01/11/recovery.html ). I see some already exist on Loopring and Argent, but am interested in contributing to an open source alternative with no additional fees.  If there's already a project along these lines, happy to contribute to it. If not, considering kicking one off.  Haven't learned Solidity yet, but am a full stack developer comfortable with Python, Go, Java, JS, etc.; I've developed similarly complex projects in the past and have several design ideas to increase adoption of social recovery wallets I'd like to contribute.  If similar projects already exist happy to help out in whatever capacity would be most beneficial (another set of eyes auditing code; UX prototypes, etc.)

author: fluffy__cat
content: Related: Is the prerequisite infrastructure ready for a project like this? In a recent podcast Vitalik explained this functionality will primarily operate in layer 2. It looks like Loopring uses their own layer 2 zkRollup implementation. The concept of a social recovery wallet seems simple enough to design and implement, but if doing so today requires further engineering of L2 protocols, it's probably too much for me to attempt as a solo volunteer. I can move this to <#595721451651465227> if that'd be better.
